page.title: 04The Cliff Railway
page.content: The Cliff Railway is an easy way of travelling from Low Town to High Town.It was constructed between November 2nd. 1891 and July 7th. 1892. During the first two months of its use, over fifty thousand passengers used it. Since 1944 the Cliff Railway has been operated by electricity although before steam power was used. The carriages are operated from a control box at the end of the Castle Walk. The Cliff Railway is the shortest and steepest funicular railway in England. The bottom station is situated opposite the river. The railway has been in use for 93 years. Every one and half feet you travel horizontally you travel one foot vertically. The maximum speed which the carriages can travel on the upward journey is 250 feet per minute.
